subject: RE: [junit] junit for set Method with boolean input and void retu	rn
msgSnippet: Cédric, I really appreciate your response, but adding a boolean isAcceptMatch() method to WmLoggerFilter, would mean changing the class which is under test.
messageBody:
Cédric,



I really appreciate your response, but adding a boolean isAcceptMatch()
method to WmLoggerFilter, would mean changing the class which is under test.
Could this be an acceptable test case?



Thanks,

-Kamal.



_____

From: junit@yahoogroups.com [mailto:junit@yahoogroups.com] On Behalf Of
cbeust@...
Sent: Monday, February 06, 2006 11:54 AM
To: junit@yahoogroups.com
Subject: Re: [junit] junit for set Method with boolean input and void return



On 2/6/06, Kamal Ahmed <KAhmed@...> wrote:
>
> I am a bit confused here, so I would appreciate a little help.
> I am trying to write a test for method:
>
> public final void setAcceptMatch(boolean inMatchFlag)
> {
> acceptMatch = inMatchFlag;
> }
>
> And here is what I have so far:
>
> public void testsetAcceptMatch() {
> WmLoggerFilter subjectWmLoggerFilter = new
> WmLoggerFilter();
> subjectWmLoggerFilter.setAcceptMatch(true);
>
> }
>
>
>
> Now, which assert method should I use to see if "acceptMatch" is true or
> not.


Add a boolean isAcceptMatch() method to WmLoggerFilter and assertTrue its
result?

--
Cédric
